message.content:
{"id": "3666", "title": "Bug 3666: Code Completion - Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)", "description": "Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature in the UI consumes excessive code. This issue can be reproduced by following the steps below:

1. Open the enclosed class.
2. Locate the call to 'baz' in the 'bar' method.
3. Add a parameter to the 'baz' call to correct the program.

The expected behavior is that the code assist should only replace the necessary source code. However, in this case, it is consuming more code than necessary.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Place the cursor after the first 'x.' in the 'baz' call.
2. Press Ctrl+Space to activate the code assist feature.
3. Type 'f' to filter the list.
4. Select 'foo()'.", "OB": "The code assist feature consumes excessive code and replaces more code than necessary.", "EB": "The code assist feature should only replace the necessary source code.", "SR": "To resolve this issue, the 'baz' call in the 'bar' method should be changed to 'baz(x.x.foo())'."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '3666', 'title': 'Bug 3666CodeCompletion  Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)', 'description': 'Bug 3666CodeCompletionHungry code assist (1GDRYW5) jkca (5/15/2001 11:04:56 AM)jresdk 106Under certain circumstances code assist eats too much code.Consider the enclosed class.As a programmer, I must add aparameter to the baz call in bar to make the program correct.Steps:1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the codeassist end position (until the end of current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, so as to controlthe amount of source to replace. Removing codeassist option. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'Change the baz call tobaz(x.x.foo())2. Place the cursor after the first "x."3. CtrlSpace to bring up code assist4. Type "f" to filter the list.5. Select, "foo()"6. '}
